data.title: Excellent Petite Filet and Brussels sprouts.
data.text: Friday night. Long, tough week. Travel, client, issues. This was a good end. The filet was a perfect and tender medium rare, the glass wine selection was good for my not so discerning palette. The staff was attentive, but not cloyingly so. My personal preference.

data.title: Fantastic & Warm Service
data.text:
My husband, my friends, and I came here for dinner. The service was fantastic. I can't say enough about our server, PJ. He was so attentive and made you feel like family.

I got the duck spring rolls as an appetizer and shared the sizzling pancake. My husband and I shared the Tomahawk rib eye (med rare), black truffle mac 'n cheese, and the brussel sprouts. The steak and brussel sprouts were both very good. I love black truffle 'anything,' but the macaroni was just so-so. I would definitely dine here again.

data.title: Decent Happy Hour
data.text: Went for happy hour. $5 beer of the night and a $14 burger. Half price wings weren't anything special. Burger was a two napkin achievement and quite tasty. All in for $27. Great ambiance in a very upscale setting. Menu was on the pricey side.

data.title: Birthday Treat!
data.text: First time to this visit and we want to thank our son who invited us to this upscale steak house. Since it was a celebration for my beautiful wife, Sharon, we indulged in an number of delectables. First off, if you like Bourbons take advance of the extension list. Our waiter helped us select two bourbons that Sharon and I both enjoyed. The next complementary disk was duck field frites or fries. Cooked with 3 different and enjoyable spices with accompanying delicious sauces. Very good. Next we ordered the entrees with my wife opting for the petite filet topped with foie gras. Delicious. I opted for the big filet and it was perfectly cooked to medium rare. Almost tender enough to cut with a fork and I would rank it in the top 4 filets I've enjoyed at similar restaurants. Side for my son  and I include the Micheal Mina signature truffle mac n chess. This is truly a winner and you must try it if you like mac n cheese . The other was a glazed Brussels sprouts which were also very good. I also want to state that they have a n extensive wine list and quite a few by the glass. I had a Napa Zin that paired nicely with the filet, and Sharon opted for a Cab. Both good. We finished with lattes that were a nice touch. By the way, use the valet service. The Steak validates up to 3 hours and you text them when you finish so the wait time is minimal. They also have various wagu from Japan, Australia, and the US. I tasted my sons, US wagu, and I prefer the filet.. If you love good steak, you need to try the Steak.

data.title: Great Steak House
data.text: I have been at Bourbon couple of times, and the place is very nice.   Excellent food, and great choices.

data.title: Not worth the price of admission
data.text: Compared to the many other steak restaurants I've patronized over the years, I cannot recommend Bourbon Steak in good conscience. The food was average at best, although I did enjoy the caesar salad. My ribeye (the boneless special ribeye, according to the waiter), was tasteless.  The prime ribeyes I've bought at Costco and grilled myself were a hundred times better.  I must praise the service.  Everyone was well-trained, attentive and knowledgeable.  If you're to spend $100/person without alcohol, spend it elsewhere.

data.title: Mina should not put his name on this restaurant
data.text:
What a huge disappointment.  We sat in the bar and we were one of maybe 5 tables eating there.  Our service was okay.  I'm willing to forgive that if the food and drinks are worth the wait.  They were not.

1.  My martini was brought out cool...it clearly was not shaken and perhaps not stirred either.  When I ordered a second and reminded the waitress that it should be icy, she agreed and said that would happen.  It did not.
2.  My sister and brother in law shared the $92 porterhouse for two.  It was grissly and not very tasty.  The dog even sniffed at it for a while before finally eating it.  That should speak volumes to anyone who has a dog.
3.  My ahi tuna was cold through the center.  Clearly it had been pre-seared, refrigerated and then put under a warming light.
4.  Our side of brocolli was so salty it was not edible (I love salt.  If I say it is salty it is really salty).
5.  My brother in law said the creamed spinach was doughy as if too much flour had been added.

The bright note was the tuna tartar appetizer which was delicious.  Of course  this had to be returned when I advised I had a garlic and dairy allergy and yet the plate showed up with garlic, cheese and a quail egg on top.  

I wish I could find a bright spot.  The only thing good I can say is the valet was around the corner so we didn't have to walk too far to get back to the car.

data.title: Wonderful restaurant!
data.text: It was Saturday night and all the restaurants were packed.  We didn't have reservations, but were able to get seats at the bar, which was even better I thought.  Awesome ambience, drinks and food.  Pricey but worth every dollar.  It was a wonderful end to our trip.

data.title: Can't beat Michael Mina
data.text: I have yet to have a bad meal at one of Michael Mina's restaurants and this one was no exception.  In the heart of Glendale it is an excellent steak house, and a beautiful restaurant.  Our server was also excellent which on enhanced our wonderful experience.  The steak was wonderful, but try the lamb shank too!

data.title: Excellent local steak house- great service!
data.text:
We had 8 people for a business dinner last night at this restaurant. While pricey we all enjoyed the evening. There were some misses- the Halibut was disappointing as was the prime rib cap.  Based on the waitress' recommendations we ordered the above and they did not live up to the expectations!
However the rest of the meal was delicious and the sommelier was very helpful and we enjoyed a nice cab.   The price was equal to a chain steakhouse but the service was exemplary- I judge service on waiting for everyone to be done before the plates are cleared as well as the filling of the water glasses with our being asked!
Good place to enjoy a nice local restaurant fare!

data.title: Good food, Excellent ambiance and service
data.text:
Good food, excellent ambiance and service.There are 3 rooms the salon, the lounge, and the main dining area. The salon is gorgeous, quiet, and more intimate. The lounge is definitely more casual and loud, and the main dining room is a mix of both with piano player.
Complimentary duck fat fries and bread with truffle butter were good.  It was our first time to try rib cap cut.  It was good, but too tender and we prefer Mastro's. I enjoyed the Scottish salmon, it was perfectly cooked and seasoned.  Brussels sprouts and mushrooms were good, but too oily and too much sugar.

data.title: Pricey, but perfection on a plate
data.text: Great food, superb service sums it up. The restaurant was half full for my 6pm booking on a Friday night, and totally full by the time I left just after 7pm, it was buzzing. The complimentary skinny fries with dips was a nice touch, and my steak was perfectly cooked and very tasty. I was concerned that there was no salt or pepper on the table, but the chef has a great hand with seasoning and I found I didn't need anything. It's not cheap, but then I feel robbed at cheap joints where the food, cooking and/or service is below-par, and I don't mind paying for great service, and good ingredients well-cooked. I recommend this restaurant and would return.

data.title: Amazing steakhouse
data.text: From the moment you walk in you know it's going to be special. There is a beautiful display of prime beef behind glass as you check in. The entire staff are warm and friendly. Our server was Lauren S. She made the night special. She was fun, personable, attentive, and friendly. We had the duck spring rolls and crab leg for starters. The spring rolls are a Mina specialty and they were amazing. We both had the rib eye cap and it was one of the best steaks we have ever tasted. The som was friendly and helpful. We had two amazing bottles of wine. The wine list is great!  Will definitely return!

data.title: Great Atmosphere Great Service Good Menu But only an OK Steak
data.text: The atmosphere was simple (Restoration Hardware type deco).    The service and dining experience was excellent.    Menu had plenty of options for everyone.   The WEST COAST OYSTERS were very good!   MICHAEL’S TUNA TARTARE was good!  This is a steakhouse and we ordered the  expensive AUSTRALIAN WAGYU TOMAHAWK RIBEYE STEAK for 2 people $138 !   To be honest this steak was good to average at best, no way worth the price.  I've had much better steaks at other steakhouses for far less.  Overall good restaurant that fills a need in Glendale, CA.    I would have normally given 3 stars but the great customer service enhanced our dining experience.

data.title: Just another steak house...
data.text: While steak quality was okay, overall dining experience and quality was nothing special.  Wine list was long with many bottles not available and took very long for it to arrive at table.  Pre dinner French fry service was an interesting touch, but not ideal for healthy eating.

data.title: OMG! Heaven on earth
data.text: We were celebrating a new contract and decided to return here. Bourbon Steak always offers a good experience. Great food and great service. I had my usual bone-in Ribeye. It was so good, it almost brought tears to my eyes. Chrissy and Richard both ordered the petite filet and raved.  The flavor just bursts from the steaks served here. Expensive, but worth every penny.

data.title: Fine dining steak house
data.text:
Very great food and service experience, anything you are looking for.

Kagoshima beef was to die for, very good dessert and perfectly executed, attentive and knowledgeable staff, jazz music, great bar sitting and detailed restaurAnt. 

Amazing cocktail!

I would recommend to anyone!

data.title: Best steak in LA
data.text: Great ambience, excellent staff and amazing food. The french fries in duck fat is out.of this world and the rib eye was jsut beyond perfect.

data.title: Fabulous Food at a Price
data.text: The food in Bourbon Steak is absolutely amazing. I had the American Waguu beef which was fantastic. But it comes at a price. The setting by Americana Mall is good and there is plenty of parking here, plus valet just out front. The service is very good. The have an area of outdoor seating as well. This is definitely a treat, but best put on an expense account.

data.title: Not Bad for a Chain Redtaurant
data.text:
Six food and wine friends joined up for a dinner at Bourbon Steak in Glendale, CA.
Two of our group had been here b4. We brought an assortment of high end wines and probably opened 8 or 9 bottles. The food and wine service is very good, the ambiance is hip and noisy yet friendly. The food was not great but good, some dishes more tasty than others. The appetizers were a mixed bag, the beef  and basic fishes were good, the desserts tasty. All in it's worth a return visit. Not bad for a chain steak house.
